title: How Many Calories in Champagne?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in champagne per standard glass, including carbs, sugars, and nutrition breakdowns for brut and sweeter varieties.
assumptions: Brut (dry) champagne, standard 150 ml serving (5 oz flute glass), no added mixers or garnishes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, sweetness level (brut vs. demi-sec), serving size, and production method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 150 ml glass of brut champagne has about 120 kcal, primarily from alcohol and residual sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Demi-sec (sweeter style with more residual sugar)

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of champagne?
faqs.a: About 120 kcal for a 150 ml glass of brut champagne.
Yes, around 3.9 g carbs per 150 ml glass, mostly sugars.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of champagne?
faqs.a: A standard 750 ml bottle has about 600 kcal, or roughly 4 glasses.

faqs.q: Does sweeter champagne have more calories?
faqs.a: Yes, demi-sec or sec varieties add 20-50 kcal per glass due to higher sugar.

faqs.q: Is champagne low in fat or protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 0 g fat and negligible protein (0.2 g) per glass.
